meanings.definition: (Latin) to go to, approach; to go to meet; to enter upon, begin; to undergo, submit to; to die
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to go to, approach; to go to meet; to enter upon, begin; to undergo, submit to; to die

examples.sentence: Ad hostes obire. (To go to meet the enemy.)

etymology.value: From Latin ob- (toward, against) + ire (to go).

verb_forms.present_active: obeo, obis, obit, obimus, obitis, obeunt
verb_forms.imperfect_active: obibam, obibas, obibat, obibamus, obibatis, obibant
verb_forms.future_active: obibo, obibis, obibit, obibimus, obibitis, obibunt
verb_forms.perfect_active: obii, obisti, obiit, obiimus, obistis, obierunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_active: obieram, obieras, obierat, obieramus, obieratis, obierant
verb_forms.future_perfect_active: obiero, obieris, obierit, obierimus, obieritis, obierint

usage_notes.explanation: "Obire" is a Latin verb with multiple meanings related to approaching, undertaking, and ultimately, death. Its specific meaning depends heavily on the context.

derivatives: obitus (noun: a going down, setting; death)

readability_explanation.text: "Obire" is a Latin verb encountered in classical texts. Understanding its various nuances requires a good grasp of Latin grammar and context.
